submission:
class Solution:
    def countSubarrays(self, v: List[int], k: int) -> int:

        s = set()
        n = len(v)
        ans = 0

        mp = {}

        for i in range(n):
            q = set()

            q.add(v[i])
            if v[i] == k:
                ans += 1
            new_mp = {}
            new_mp[v[i]] = new_mp.get(v[i], 0) + 1

            for z in s:
                new_and = z & v[i]
                q.add(new_and)
                new_mp[new_and] = new_mp.get(new_and, 0) + mp.get(z, 0)
                if new_and == k:
                    ans += mp.get(z, 0)

            mp = new_mp
            s = q

        return ans

# # Example usage
# if __name__ == "__main__":
#     v = [1, 2, 3, 4]  # Example input array
#     k = 2  # Example k value
#     print(count_subarrays(v, k))  # Output the result
